data.title: JOSEPH MATTHEW DIMAGGIO Obituary 2020
data.meta_description: DIMAGGIO suddenly April 1, 2020 Joseph Matthew Dimaggio Beloved Son of Joe Dimaggio and His Wife Faye, and loving Son of Ma Dukes Linda Dimaggio of Noblesville, Indiana & her li...
data.text:
DIMAGGIO suddenly April 1, 2020 Joseph Matthew Dimaggio Beloved Son of Joe Dimaggio and His Wife Faye, and loving Son of Ma Dukes Linda Dimaggio of Noblesville, Indiana & her life long partner Tommy the good old boy. Devoted Brother of Tony Dimaggio and His Partner Laurel of South Boston, Destiny & Michael McDermott of Noblesville, Indiana, as well as his beautiful niece Maddie McDermott and nephew Dylan McDermott of Noblesville, Indiana. Also Survived by Auntie Sharon, Auntie Patty, Uncle Howie, Uncle Robert and the love of his life, Kylee Connolly of Quincy. Loved and adored by his second family Kassidy Capillo, Guy Capillo, Leandra Ellis as well as many relatives and friends. Due to health restrictions with covid 19 a memorial service will be held at a later date.

Joseph DiMaggio had a contagious smile and an infectious personality. He lit up every room he walked into. Joseph had a brilliant mind with many aspirations and goals. He was incredibly selfless, loyal and genuine. His heart was pure and he loved everyone unconditionally. Joey impacted so many lives, especially in the recovery community. He remained positive even in the toughest of times, a true warrior. Joey, you are loved by so many. You will be sorely missed for you were one of a kind that can never be replaced. Memorial visitation will be held in the Wm. F. Spencer Funeral Home 575 E. Broadway (at H st) South Boston on Tuesday June 30 th from 11 Am to 1 PM. concluding with interment in the Gardens at Gethsemane Cemetery 670 Baker St. West Roxbury MA. 02132 at 1:30 PM. Relatives and Friends kindly invited.

.
